frontmatter.title: LeetCode 82. Remove Duplicates from Sorted List II

previous.body:
Today I chose an easy problem since I had a late day at work and gym afterwards.

___

# Solution
```python
from collections import deque

# Definition for a binary tree node.
# class TreeNode:
#     def __init__(self, val=0, left=None, right=None):
#         self.val = val
#         self.left = left
#         self.right = right
class Solution:
    def isSameTree(self, p: Optional[TreeNode], q: Optional[TreeNode]) -> bool:
        pQ = deque([p])
        qQ = deque([q])

        while pQ and qQ:
            nodeP = pQ.popleft()
            nodeQ = qQ.popleft()
            if nodeP and nodeQ and nodeP.val != nodeQ.val:
                return False
            elif (nodeP is None) != (nodeQ is None):
                return False

            if nodeP:
                pQ.append(nodeP.left)
                pQ.append(nodeP.right)
            if nodeQ:
                qQ.append(nodeQ.left)
                qQ.append(nodeQ.right)

        if not pQ and not qQ:
            return True
        
        return False
```
Time complexity is O(n) = n and space complexity is O(n).

next.body:
I had to read the comments to understand this problem. I didn't understand how they wanted the ordering until I read a few examples.

___

# Solution
```python
# Definition for singly-linked list.
# class ListNode:
#     def __init__(self, val=0, next=None):
#         self.val = val
#         self.next = next
class Solution:
    def partition(self, head: Optional[ListNode], x: int) -> Optional[ListNode]:
        start = head
        left, right = None, None

        while head and not right:
            if head.val < x:
                left = head
            else:
                right = head
            head = head.next
        
        prev = None
        
        while head:
            if head.val < x:
                if prev:
                    prev.next = head.next
                if left:
                    left.next = head
                    left = left.next
                else:
                    left = head
                    start = left
                if right.next == head:
                    right.next = head.next
                head.next = right

            prev = head
            head = head.next
        
        return start
```
Time complexity is O(n) = n and space complexity is O(1).
